conversation.text: Hello. It looks like we'll be making poached eggs in the oven today. The first step will be to preheat the oven to 425˚F. Are you ready?
Alright, now grease a muffin tin or ramekins depending on how many eggs you want to make.
evidence: Grease a muffin tin with a light coat of cooking spray

conversation.text: I have 6 eggs, so is it that I need to grease 6 muffin tins?
Yes, that's right! The recipe also says that a butter-flavored cooking spray might work well for flavor. Do you have it? If not, regular oil is fine.
evidence: If you want to make 12 eggs, then grease 12 wells

conversation.text: No, I can just go with the regular one. What's next after greasing?
Next, crack an egg into each muffin tin. Leave them whole (without stirring or scrambling). There will be one whole egg in each muffin tin.
evidence: Crack 1 egg into each muffin tin or ramekin

conversation.text: This step is important to keep the egg whites from drying out. Pour 1-2 tablespoons of heavy cream, or melted butter if you don't have heavy cream, over each egg.
evidence: Pour 1 to 2 teaspoons of heavy cream over each egg

conversation.text: Do I need to mix it with the egg?
Nope, the egg should be left whole so just pour it on top.
I have finished it. What's next?
Next, season the eggs with salt, pepper, and grated Parmesan if you want. You only need a dash of salt/pepper and a tablespoon of Parmesan.
evidence: Season the eggs with salt, pepper, and grated cheese, if desired

conversation.text: A dash of salt/pepper and a tablespoon of parmesan for each egg?

evidence: A dash of salt and pepper is all you really need
add 1 tablespoon (7.5 g) of grated Parmesan

conversation.text: Next, you'll have to bake the eggs for 7-12 minutes, depending on how firm you want them. Do you want soft, medium, or firm eggs?
evidence: Bake the eggs for 7 to 12 minutes

conversation.text: Alright, then bake them 7-8 minutes. Serve them as soon as possible and season more if you'd like!
evidence: If you made soft-center eggs, then enjoy them as soon as you can.

procedure.description: It doesn't matter whether or not your oven runs hot or cool. Because you're baking these eggs out side of their shells, it'll be easier to determine whether or not they're done baking. These eggs are essentially what you'd get if you cracked an egg open on a frying pan.

procedure.summary: Grease a muffin tin with a light coat of cooking spray.
procedure.description: How many wells on the muffin tin you grease depends on how many eggs you want to make. If you want to make 12 eggs, then grease 12 wells. If you want to make 3 eggs, then grease only 3 wells. You can use ramekins too. Place these on a baking sheet to make them easier to take in and out of the oven. A butter-flavored cooking spray would work especially well here because it will give the eggs a pan-fried flavor.

procedure.summary: Crack 1 egg into each muffin tin or ramekin.
procedure.description: Again, how many eggs you crack open depends on how many you want to make. Most muffin tins can hold 6 to 12 eggs, depending on the number of wells that they have. Do not break, stir, or scramble the yolks.

procedure.summary: Pour 1 to 2 teaspoons of heavy cream over each egg.
procedure.description: If you don't have heavy cream, or don't want to use it, try melted butter instead. This is very important because it will help keep the egg whites from drying out in the oven.

procedure.summary: Season the eggs with salt, pepper, and grated cheese, if desired.
procedure.description: A dash of salt and pepper is all you really need. For extra flavor, add 1 tablespoon (7.5 g) of grated Parmesan cheese over each egg.

procedure.summary: Bake the eggs for 7 to 12 minutes.
procedure.description:
The longer you bake the eggs, the more firm they will become. Soft-center eggs are great if you want to eat them for breakfast on a plate. If you wish to use the eggs in a breakfast sandwich, however, a firm-center egg would work better because it won't be as runny. Listed below are the recommended baking times:
Soft: 7 to 8 minutes
Medium: 9 to 10 minutes
Firm: 11 to 12 minutes

procedure.summary: Serve the eggs as soon as you take them out of the oven.
procedure.description: The eggs will continue to cook from the inside, so they will become more firm as time goes by. If you made soft-center eggs, then enjoy them as soon as you can. Add more flavor to the eggs by seasoning them with dried herbs or extra shredded cheese.
